reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The Maap Community Health Center serves a population of over 850 and is 1 of 4 feeder clinics for the larger hospital in Colonia. The facility lacks funding for general maintenance and scheduled up-keep and is deteriorating due to extreme tropical climate. The facility's condition is run-down, non-conducive to patient care and the prolonged lack of maintenance could soon result in structural damage. This project will return the facility to a serviceable condition by exterior maintenance such as new paint, cleaning and general repairs. This project will be completed by US Navy Seabees, Clinic Staff and Local Volunteers as a way to preserve the clinic facility, improve provisions of care and demonstrate the importance of capitol reinvestment and doing regular maintenance.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Spread over a million square miles of ocean on 607 islands and with over half of the population and supporting infrastructure located in low-lying coastal areas, the Federated States of Micronesia (FSM) is highly vulnerable to natural disasters, including typhoons, landslides, drought, and storm surges (waves). As required under P.L. 108-188, the Compact of Free Association Act of 2003, USAID coordinates and implements disaster relief and reconstruction assistance in the FSM. To protect public health and safety, U.S. assistance increases the FSM's capacity to quickly respond to and manage disasters.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Overseas Humanitarian, Disaster, and Civic Aid, Defense
